text:
BERRAK FATMA DOGRUER 
143 Albany Street  Apt.133B  Cambridge, MA 02139
Home: (617) 225-8199  e-mail: berrak@mit.edu
EDUCATION
MIT SLOAN SCHOOL OF MANAGEMENT, 1999-2001 Cambridge, MA
Candidate for MBA, June 2001, Strategic Management and Consulting Track
Co-President for Marketing Club
Member of Management Consulting Club and European Club
Elected by classmates to Sloan Student Senate 
Member of Ambassador Program for prospective students
GETTYSBURG COLLEGE, 1992-1996 Gettysburg, PA
B.A. Economics and Physics, May 1996
Graduated Magna Cum Laude and with Departmental Honors in Economics
Phi Beta Kappa and Alpha Lambda Delta Member (honor society for freshmen)  
President of a club that strives to educate peers about socially responsible drinking   
Awarded scholarship for demonstrating leadership on campus and excellence in academics
EXPERIENCE
BOOZ·ALLEN & HAMILTON, SUMMER 2000 London, U.K.
Summer Associate: Worked on two different engagements in Berlin and London
Due diligence study for a possible acquisition : Analyzed the cost structure of the company to be acquired and 
provided understanding of its product offerings and market position to my team. Presented and defended findings to 
senior client staff.  Identified about 15% potential savings in the procurement area, which, along with the other 
savings opportunities, led to a “go” decision.
Cost reduction and reorganization study : Prepared a report on industry research in the real estate markets in Europe,
competitive analysis and specific country trends.  Identified areas of cost reductions (up to 33%) in two departments 
through streamlining and improving processes.
NATIONAL ECONOMIC RESEARCH ASSOCIATES, INC., 1996-1999
(DIVISION OF MERCER CONSULTING GROUP) Washington, DC
Analyst (’98-’99); Associate Analyst (‘97-’98) - Worked as part of various teams 
Advised clients on the competitive effects of mergers among high-profile electric utilities 
Evaluated different strategic alternatives for prominent electric utilities and helped them decide on divestiture 
or acquisition of assets and market penetration  
Facilitated a recent complex merger between two major national HMOs 
Represented company at university recruiting sessions 
Research Assistant (’96-‘97)
Performed economic analysis in securities fraud litigation cases 
Conducted anti-competitive behavior analysis in the health care industry by identifying market participants and 
defining relevant geographic and product markets 
Developed a valuation model for an electric power plant in order to advise our client on the profitability of the 
investment
VAILLANT GMBH U. CO., SUMMER 1995 Remscheid, Germany
Intern as member of a multinational team on European Market Strategy Project
Conducted a market structure assessment of water heaters in Turkey and produced a final report on the general 
outlook of the energy sector and its most recent developments
Researched the economies of Eastern European Countries and identified investment opportunities
OTHER LEADERSHIP EXPERIENCE
GETTYSBURG COLLEGE, 1992-1996 Gettysburg, PA
Resident Coordinator:  Counseled and supervised 40-60 upper-class students with academic, personal or 
disciplinary matters in hall. Guided staff members in working with residents.
Peer Tutor in Physics, Calculus and the German Language and Microeconomics Teaching Assistant
PERSONAL
Fluent in Turkish and proficient in German
Member of Toastmasters International in Washington, DC
Enjoy swimming, tennis, singing and travel
